author: centennial
title: Future of Taiwan diplomatic ties uncertain: Lin – 22 Oct 2015
text: Needed: ‘Daang matino’ The distance between the cities of San Juan and Makati is approximately eight kilometers. At the prescribed speed limit of 40 kilometers per hour, it should take 13-15 minutes to travel this distance by car on Edsa. It is a route I am familiar with because it has become a nearly inevitable part of my daily life, and indeed the lives of so many others whose everyday path to their places of work lea China: Watch for urgent policy changes. For a long time, investors have been right to assume that China’s policy makers would do enough to prevent the multiple imbalances in its economy from coalescing into a major slowdown or even a full-blown crisis. That assumption may not be valid anymore: Not only is China’s economy losing momentum despite a range of policy measures last year but the imbalances appear more threatening than befo What will drive global markets? Financial markets have been on a wild ride since the year began. Prices of equities, bonds, currencies and commodities have fluctuated, sometimes wildly, and have confounded the forecasts of the best pundits. How does an investor make sense of this market turbulence? Perhaps a good starting point is to try and clarify the likely directions that the major determinants of investment returns - cashfl Singapore: Where is the economy heading? The portents for the Singapore economy have been mixed of late. Despite a strong labour market buoying retail sales, other drivers of growth are flagging. The global economy has been disappointing, with weakness in the Eurozone, Japan and China offsetting a strengthening American economy. Some of our neighbouring economies have faced challenges and businesses at home appear to be less confident th
